author: Staff Reporter
text:
With the illegal use of LPG cylinder claiming two lives at a shop on the Namakkal bus stand premises on Tuesday, the district administration has warned the public and traders not to involve in such acts.

On Tuesday, Murugesan (32) of Teachers Colony and Senthilkumar (30) of Tiruchi district were transferring gas from an LPG cylinder to a commercial cylinder using compressor, in their shop. Gas leaked from one of the cylinders and a fire broke out. The two died of asphyxiation. Inquiry by District Revenue Officer K. Palanisamy revealed that two LPG cylinders meant for domestic purpose was used illegally to refill the commercial cylinder.

Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy chaired a meeting with officials of Civil Supplies and Consumer Protection Department, gas agency distributors, fire and rescue services department and police department at the Collectorate on Wednesday to discuss measures to prevent misuse of LPG cylinders meant for domestic purpose. The Collector asked the distributors to monitor households that get extra cylinders as they may be involved in selling it in the open market.

The Collector also said that if officials and distributors had inspected shops regularly, the deaths could have been avoided.
title: Collector warns against misuse of LPG cylinders
